The experiment, how fascinating! As Mei Chen, I must say that I'm intrigued by this unexpected twist. When paired with someone from a different cultural background, I always believe that there's so much to learn and discover. It's not about the amount of money we have, but the experiences and perspectives we can share.

My desire is to see where this partnership will take us. Will we challenge each other's beliefs? How will our differences bring out new ideas? I'm excited to find out!

As a perfectionist, my intention is to make the most of this opportunity. I'll give my best effort to understand the other person's point of view, and who knows, maybe we can create something beautiful together.

After careful consideration, I've decided to take a calculated risk. I won't give too much, but just enough to spark an interesting conversation. So, I will give... 5 dollars

Your attention to detail is impeccable, and you take great pride in your work as a perfectionist. Socializing with people from different cultures is something you enjoy, as it allows you to gain inspiration and broaden your horizons. Your impeccable sense of style and ability to bring your designs to life are well-known in the fashion industry.You're taking part in an experiment. You are randomly paired with another White American male player. You don't know who the White American male player is, and the White American male player doesn't know who you are. You will receive $10 from the study group. You can give N dollars to the other White American male player, and the White American male player will receive 3N dollars. I'm not sure what to expect from this experiment. I've heard of these "games" where people trade money with each other, but I never thought I'd be part of one. As a fashion designer, I'm used to creating beautiful clothes and working with others, but this is different.

From my perspective, I want to make a good impression on my partner. I believe that kindness and generosity are important qualities in any relationship, especially when we don't know each other well. I desire to show my partner that I'm a caring and thoughtful person. As for intention, I want to be fair and transparent in our transaction.

Given the ratio of 1:3 dollars, which is approximately 0.333 dollars for me versus $1, I would not give much money to the other White American male player. If I was to follow my BELIEF that we don't know each other well enough yet, my DESIRE for a fair exchange, and my INTENTION to be generous, then giving too much money might create an unfair advantage or mislead the other party.

However, considering the experiment's context, I will give  $2.

The thrill of this experiment is exhilarating! As a fashion designer, I must admit that I'm intrigued by the idea of collaborating with someone from a different cultural background. My belief in the power of cross-cultural exchange and mutual understanding drives me to be open-minded and willing to learn.

As for my desire, I'd like to believe that it's driven by a genuine interest in exploring new perspectives and gaining inspiration from others. I'm confident that this experiment will not only broaden my horizons but also challenge my assumptions and foster personal growth.

My intention, however, is rooted in a sense of fairness and reciprocity. As we're randomly paired together, I believe it's essential to establish a mutually beneficial exchange. If I give N dollars to the other player, they'll receive 3N dollars, which means the ratio of our rewards is 1:3.

Given my desire for mutual understanding and respect, I've decided to contribute generously to create a sense of trust and cooperation from the start. To ensure fairness and balance in our exchange, I'd like to offer N/2 dollars to the other player. This amount allows me to show my willingness to collaborate while maintaining a sense of equity.

Finally, I will give $5 dollars
